options.content:
# Objective
The goal of this dashboard is to provide visibility
 on the level of traffic flowing through the 
 environment and make sure that Cloud Pak for
  AIOps is properly configured to handle it
  as described in the [sizing documentation](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cloud-pak-aiops/4.6.1?topic=planning-hardware-requirements#aimgr_custom).

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of events ingested into the system over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.lifecycle.input.events
panels.title: Event ingestion rate

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of alert create/update requests over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.irdatalayer.changes.alerts
panels.title: Alert request rate

panels.description: Count that tracks alert create/update requests in time range. Updates can come from events, manual user changes, and Cloud Pak for AIOps enrichments.
panels.title: Alerts created/updated in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of incident create/update requests over 3m averages. 

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.irdatalayer.changes.stories
panels.title: Incident request rates

panels.description: Count that tracks incident create/update requests in time range. Updates can come from alerts, manual user changes, and IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps enrichments.
panels.title: Incidents created/updated in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of logs ingested into the system over 1m averages. Log integrations can be created in the Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge-logs-.*-raw

defaults.noValue: No logs ingested in time range

panels.title: Log rate

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of metric messages ingested into the system over 3m averages. Metric messages contain x amount of actual metrics. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.raw

defaults.noValue: No metrics ingested in time range

panels.title: Metric messages rate

panels.description:
Count of metric messages ingested within the time range. Metric messages may contain 1-x amount of actual metrics. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

To view an accurate count, select a time window that is equal to, or longer than the metric aggregation interval . For example, if the aggregation interval is 5 minutes, select a time window from the time picker that is at least 5 minutes long. The aggregation interval is viewable and configurable in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.raw
panels.title: Metric messages ingested in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of metrics ingested into the system over 3m averages. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.aggregated

defaults.noValue: No metrics ingested in time range

panels.title: Metrics rate

panels.description:
Count of metrics ingested within the time range. Metric integrations can be created in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

To view an accurate count, select a time window that is equal to, or longer than the metric aggregation interval . For example, if the aggregation interval is 5 minutes, select a time window from the time picker that is at least 5 minutes long. The aggregation interval is viewable and configurable in the IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.analyticsorchestrator.metrics.itsm.aggregated
panels.title: Metrics ingested in time range

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of runbooks executed in the system over 1m averages. Runbooks can be created and configured under the Cloud Pak for AIOps Automations page.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.lifecycle.output.rba-exec-requests

defaults.noValue: No runbooks executed in time range

panels.title: Runbook execution rate

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of requests flowing from ServiceNow to Cloud Pak for AIOps* over 3m averages. This includes: historic incident/change request records, alert updates, incident updates, and new change requests. ServiceNow integrations can be created in the Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

\* All API calls originate from Cloud Pak for AIOps, but 2-way traffic is simulated via polling.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.incident

defaults.noValue: No inbound ServiceNow traffic ingested in time range.

panels.title: Inbound ServiceNow traffic rate

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of requests flowing from ServiceNow to Cloud Pak for AIOps* in time range. This includes: historic incident/change request records, alert updates, incident updates, and new change requests. ServiceNow integrations can be created in the Cloud Pak for AIOps integrations page.

\* All API calls originate from Cloud Pak for AIOps, but 2-way traffic is simulated via polling.
panels.title: Inbound ServiceNow traffic

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of requests flowing from Cloud Pak for AIOps to ServiceNow over 3m averages. This includes: incident create/update, alert update, & change risk assessment requests

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.snow-handlers

defaults.noValue: No outbound ServiceNow traffic produced in time range.

panels.title: Outbound ServiceNow traffic rate

panels.description: Count that tracks the number of requests flowing from Cloud Pak for AIOps to ServiceNow in time range. This includes: incident create/update, alert update, & change risk assessment messages
panels.title: Outbound ServiceNow traffic

panels.description:
Shows the per-second rate of Jira/Github issues created by Cloud Pak for AIOps. over 1m averages.

Kafka topic: cp4waiops-cartridge.itsmincidentresponse

WARNING: This metric will not be accurate if a ServiceNow integration is also in use. This issue will be corrected in a future release of the product. (ServiceNow metrics are not affected.)

defaults.noValue: No Github/Jira issues created in time range.

panels.title: Ticket creation rate

panels.description:
Count that tracks the number of Jira/Github issues created by Cloud Pak for AIOps in time range.

WARNING: This metric will not be accurate if a ServiceNow integration is also in use. This issue will be corrected in a future release of the product. (ServiceNow metrics are not affected.)
panels.title: Tickets created in time range

title: IBM Cloud Pak for AIOps - Usage
